title: CATEGORICAL EXEMPTION and TRADE, TRAVEL AND TOURISM COMMITTEE REPORT relative to the Second Amendment to Reimbursement Agreement No. DA-4914 with Signature Flight Support LLC, for reimbursements to Los Angeles World Airports (LAWA) for United States (U.S.) Customs and Border Protection facility expenses at the Van Nuys Airport.

appearances.recommendation: CONCUR with the determination by the Board of Airport Commissioners (BOAC) that this action is categorically exempt from the California Environmental Quality Act (CEQA) pursuant to Article III, Class 1(18)(c) of the Los Angeles City CEQA Guidelines. APPROVE BOAC Resolution No. 28140 authorizing a Second Amendment to Reimbursement Agreement No. DA-4914 between the LAWA and Signature Flight Support, LLC extending the term by three years, with two one-year extension options, retroactive to May 21, 2025, for a total term of 15 years, from May 21, 2015, through May 20, 2030, for the reimbursement of $480,000 in annual fees paid by the LAWA to the U.S. Customs and Border Protection for facility expenses at the Van Nuys Airport. AUTHORIZE the Chief Executive Officer, LAWA, or designee, to execute the proposed amendment upon approval by the Council and approval as to form by the City Attorney. REQUEST LAWA, in coordination with the City Attorney, to report on protections and protocols that can be incorporated into LAWA reimbursement and lease agreements relative to immigration enforcement requests to access its property. Fiscal Impact Statement: The City Administrative Officer reports that approval of the proposed Second Amendment to Reimbursement Agreement No. DA- 4914 between the LAWA and Signature Flight Support, LLC will have no impact on the City’s General Fund. The proposed Amendment extends the term of the Agreement by three years, with two one-year extension options, for an additional term of five years, and a total agreement term of 15 years, for CBP facility expenses at the Van Nuys Airport. The $480,000 annual cost of CBP services are fully reimbursed by Signature. The proposed Amendment complies with the LAWA’s financial policies. Community Impact Statement: None submitted. TIME LIMIT FILE - NOVEMBER 8, 2025 (LAST DAY FOR COUNCIL ACTION - NOVEMBER 7, 2025) Report from Trade, Travel and Tourism Committee 10-28-25 Report from Board of Airport Commissioners dated 4-21-25 Attachment to Report dated 4-21-25 - Board Report Attachment to Report dated 4-21-25 - Resolution Attachment to Report dated 4-21-25 - Agreement Attachment to Report dated 4-21-25 - Mayor Transmittal Attachment to Report dated 4-21-25 - CAO Report

attachments.title: Report from Trade, Travel and Tourism Committee 10-28-25
attachments.summary:
# Summary: Council File 20-0538-S1
## Second Amendment to Customs and Border Protection Reimbursement Agreement at Van Nuys Airport

**What is being proposed:**
The Los Angeles City Council is being asked to approve a Second Amendment to a reimbursement agreement (DA-4914) between Los Angeles World Airports (LAWA) and Signature Flight Support LLC. The amendment extends the agreement's term by three years with two optional one-year extensions, running through May 20, 2030. This agreement covers the costs of maintaining a United States Customs and Border Protection (CBP) facility at Van Nuys Airport.

**Why and key details:**
The amendment addresses the ongoing need to support federal customs operations at Van Nuys Airport. Under this arrangement, LAWA pays $480,000 annually for CBP facility expenses, but this cost is fully reimbursed by Signature Flight Support LLC—meaning there is no cost to the City's General Fund. The original agreement began in 2015 and this extension will bring the total term to 15 years (2015-2030).

**Importantly added by the committee:**
The Trade, Travel and Tourism Committee approved the recommendation with an additional amendment requesting that LAWA and the City Attorney develop protections and protocols for future reimbursement and lease agreements regarding immigration enforcement requests to access airport property. This reflects community concerns about immigration enforcement activities.

**Impact:**
This primarily affects Van Nuys Airport operations and maintains federal customs screening capabilities. The approval allows continued CBP operations with no financial burden to the city, while the committee's additional request seeks to establish safeguards around immigration enforcement access to city airport property.

attachments.title: Report from Board of Airport Commissioners dated 4-21-25
attachments.summary:
# Summary: Second Amendment to Reimbursement Agreement with Signature Flight Support LLC

## What is Being Proposed?

The Board of Airport Commissioners is asking the City Council to approve a second amendment to an existing reimbursement agreement (DA-4914) with Signature Flight Support LLC. The amendment would extend the current contract term by three years, with two additional one-year extension options available.

## What is the Agreement About?

This reimbursement agreement covers costs related to United States Customs and Border Protection (CBP) facility operations at Van Nuys Airport. Under the agreement, Signature Flight Support reimburses Los Angeles World Airports (LAWA) for expenses associated with maintaining the CBP facility, which processes international travelers and cargo at the airport.

## Key Details

- **Location:** Van Nuys Airport
- **Extension:** 3 years with 2 optional one-year renewals (potential total of 5 additional years)
- **Financial Impact:** No impact to the City's General Fund—costs are covered through reimbursements from the private contractor
- **Approval Date:** Board of Airport Commissioners approved this on April 17, 2025 (Resolution 28140)
- **Environmental Status:** Determined exempt from California Environmental Quality Act (CEQA) requirements

## Impact

This agreement primarily affects airport operations and international travel processing at Van Nuys Airport. By extending the contract, it ensures continued funding for CBP facility maintenance without requiring City General Fund support, allowing the airport to maintain federal customs operations efficiently.

Attachment to Report dated 4-21-25 - Agreement
attachments.summary:
# Summary: Second Amendment to Reimbursement Agreement with Signature Flight Support LLC

## What is Being Proposed?

The City of Los Angeles is extending its reimbursement agreement with Signature Flight Support LLC, a private aviation services company operating at Van Nuys Airport. This Second Amendment extends the contract term from May 20, 2025 to May 20, 2028, and updates the contact information for notices to the company.

## Why?

The original agreement, established in 2014, requires Signature Flight Support to reimburse the City for costs associated with U.S. Customs and Border Protection inspectional services at Van Nuys Airport. The agreement was previously extended in 2020, and this amendment continues that arrangement for an additional three years to maintain consistent funding for customs inspection operations.

## Key Details

- **Agreement Number:** DA-4914 (originally signed August 27, 2014)
- **New Expiration Date:** May 20, 2028 (extended from May 20, 2025)
- **Extension Options:** The City retains two one-year extension options, exercisable by the Chief Executive Officer
- **Termination Rights:** The City can terminate with 120 days advance written notice
- **Company Contact:** Signature Flight Support LLC, located at 7420 Hayvenhurst Place, Van Nuys, CA 91406
- **Contact Person:** Tomasz Wysocki, COO Brad Williams authorized the agreement on behalf of Signature

## Impact

This extension ensures continued financial reimbursement to the City for providing customs inspection services at Van Nuys Airport, benefiting airport operations and trade facilitation. The agreement affects Signature Flight Support's operational costs and the City's Department of Airports revenue.

attachments.title: Attachment to Report dated 4-21-25 - Mayor Transmittal
attachments.summary:
# Summary: Van Nuys Airport Customs Facility Reimbursement Agreement Amendment

## What is Being Proposed
The Los Angeles City Council is being asked to consider Resolution No. 28140 and approve a second amendment to an existing reimbursement agreement (DA-4914) between Los Angeles World Airports and Signature Flight Support, LLC. This agreement relates to funding for United States Customs and Border Protection (CBP) facility expenses at Van Nuys Airport.

## Background and Rationale
The document indicates this is a follow-up action to an existing reimbursement agreement already in place with Signature Flight Support. By amending the agreement a second time, the city appears to be adjusting or updating the terms for how CBP facility costs at Van Nuys Airport are handled and reimbursed between the parties involved.

## Key Details
- **Location:** Van Nuys Airport
- **Parties involved:** Los Angeles World Airports, Signature Flight Support LLC, and U.S. Customs and Border Protection
- **Document date:** July 8, 2025
- **Recipient:** John Ackerman, Chief Executive Officer of the Department of Airports
- **Council District:** 6

## Impact
This amendment affects operations at Van Nuys Airport and involves the coordination of federal customs facilities with local airport management and private flight support services. The specific details of how residents or airport users will be affected are not detailed in this transmittal document, though the City Administrative Officer report (referenced as attached) would provide additional context.
